title: Design Verification and Commissioning
content: HF objectives specified during design must be verified during construction and commissioning. Walk-throughs, mock-ups, and usability testing catch design compromises before operations begin. Verify that valves, panels, and escape routes meet HF specifications. Don't assume design intent survived construction.

scenario.story: During commissioning, you discover critical valves are blocked by newly installed piping. The design drawings show clear access. What went wrong with the HF integration process?

options.B: HF verification wasn't performed during construction
options.C: Piping is more important than valve access

scenario.explanation: Design intent must be verified during construction. HF walk-throughs during installation would have caught this deviation before commissioning.

openQuestions: How does your organization verify HF requirements during commissioning?
